intro: Scrophularia longifolia, commonly known as purple toadflax, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually purple or violet, with a distinctive two-lipped structure, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Scrophularia longifolia is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
